locked: ^You need a key to open the door

lockedBoat: ^You need the boat key. Probably in some government employee's hand.

EnterTailorShop: ^This is definitely not your head. Your appearance should've been well-maintained.
^It twitches and twists and has every organ fighting each other.
^But this is your head. This is your head now, and this has been your head since at least 50 years ago.
^You know you are stuck here, with this pathetic tailor.
^And our tailor, "A", is about to shut his store down.
^But first, he needs to find his last 3 orders and deliver them to his last customers.
IntroChoices: ^And besides, the pain of sickness is almost killing him for the second time.
^If that's the tailor, who am I?
KillSecondTime: ^Why, my friend. We are all dead. A common sense, you know?
WhatOrders: ^Guess what? You are a tailor. And what else? You make customized clothes for our dead citizens. Your last orders are in the box. Your customers will only pay you once the clothes are delivered.
BusinessNotRun: ^"People hardly need to buy new ones after purchasing my crafts, for they are far too durable and good. And the population decreases nonstop. Frankly, I've only received three orders this year."
WhoAmI: ^You don't know. The only thing you know is that you can talk to the tailor, and you are stuck with this poor patient.
DummyDialogues: ^The clothes stiches look unfinished. The decayed texture indicates that the work was quitted a long time ago.
^"So, you made mostly women's clothing, coats, skirts, and the like"
^"Are you not going to complete this order?"
BackThen: ^"Maybe 90, 100 years ago, yes. Back then, every dead pursued fashion and tailored clothes.
^"But as people lived longer and longer, they no longer found joy in the craftsmanship of an old tailor like me."
CouldntPay: ^"Maybe she escaped to the living's realm. Maybe she died again, for good."
water: ^"No, I'm leaving this town. I've decided. It's gonna die anyways."
WaterNot: ^"No, I'm leaving this town. I've decided. It's gonna die anyways."
dressmakerDummy: ^(test)Test lose score function to lose 1 point
RFOnStart: ^"She wasn't rugged like this 30 years ago, and so wasn't I."
^"What have you been up to these days?"
^The tailor finds no more topic with RF
RFExperience: ^RF:"One lived as an architect and designed the Fraternity Center.
^Then one started an advertising agency, but it went bankrupt.
^After two years, one got bored and decided to run for mayor.
^Later, one turned to studying mathematics, which took up a hundred years of my time. Mathematics is an excellent way to waste one's endless life, and even now, one is still..."
^"I admire your resistance for the pain of living."
^"Sounds like a good way of distraction."
RFNewLanguage: ^RF:"One is creating a new language, allowing us, the dead, to communicate with seagulls and pigeons."
BirdLanguage: ^RF spilled her all her bird vocabulary out on A:"sghoagapohpengp   2 wgH  11OPHFP hadsB1poAFKABGWVW"
^RF:"This is all the progress one has gotten to."
^"A never-fading memory only has its pros at these times"
RFTalk: ^"Haven't seen you since your Mayor term ended 30 years ago."
^RF:"You look different from 30 years ago. Got two more hands, A?"
^"You actually remember the appearance of everyone who voted for you, RF."
^"Your memory is extraordinary.even among the deads."
^"Well,something happened. Something I cannot forget. Please don't make me recall."
RFRoundInSecondRound: ^RF:" Too much things happened, and we remember too much. There are no such big hats that can cover for our symptoms now."
^"And they stopped ordering camouflouges from me."
^"That's right. Some cowards simply stay at home since nothing is big enough to cover their faces."
^"Everydead is barely hanging on, good old Mayor."
RFSecondRound: ^RF:"One would say it is the basic being in politics. But perhaps you were the only one exposing the symptoms back then when everyone else was hiding behind hats, cloaks, or masks."
^ "Their hats, cloaks, and masks were probably made by me."
^ "I have a trend on my own right."
^"You weren't as blocky when you first became mayor, too."
RFThirdRound: ^RF says:"Maybe, but some things need to be remembered. Better to remember than to forget, right, sir? These are just a tiny whiney side product of knowledge and wisdom."
^"Better to live a damned eternal life than die for good?"
^"I assume your devotion to Math and seagulls has dramatically relieved your pain of being haunted by stacks of past."
^"ONE can tell you have a true love in Math, or bird language."
^ "You see, this is exactly why you've only had one term, dear old Mayor."

c-4: ^"You never empathizes with your citizen's pain and turmoil."
^RF replies:"One typically recalls your appearance for you threw tomatoes at one's campaign."

FlyerRF: ^"Ralph Fortson will deliver a mayoral campaign speech at the Park Square on October 19, 903, at 3:00 PM."
^A shrugs,"It's all about things from over thirty years ago.
^Sigh, ever since the last gardener fled to the upper city, the Park Square has become a wasteland overgrown with grass."
NewspaperOnStreet: ^"July 13, 916, gang shooting at port, 61 deads shot dead, with the injured being treated at the central medical facility. NNI insurance company filed for bankruptcy, with only 19 customers receiving compensation."
^"We invite all citizens to out protest on Aug 18, 916."
^A lowers the newspaper and says:"I sewed shrouds for all of them. Back then, I had a small workshop and hired two assistants."
^"Strange that people still wanted to live at that day. Live like deads."
^"After attending these people's funerals, I returned to my studio and fell asleep for three days straight. Where was another hand on the back of my head when I woke up."
FlyerLighthouse: ^"Lighthouse Keeper, KB, is arrested with a creww of 5, on their way of escaping to the living's city. ---THE UNION BULLITIN"
^"Hey, he is one of my customers..."
^"I might need to find him in prison and pay for his hat."
^"Everyone is running away. Maybe I should do the same."

c-1: ^"I haven't been in jail in my death of 250 years yet, so I'm not afraid to get caught."

Deadbody: ^A mess consist of dried blood, newspapers, and burnt files.
^The tailor murmurs:"I guess the janitor also run away. Also the city management department of some sort."
TalkToCE: ^Talk To the spiky front desk lady, CE.
CEFirstRound: ^CE says:"Wait, you are...? My memory isn't as good as you fellas. "
^"I was a tailor. I was THE tailor. Recall anything?" A replies.
^CE says:"A tailor? How fantastic! It sure is a rare career in this city."
CEFIrstRoundChoices: ^"Any dead is rare in this city. The population is only about 100, you know."
^"Actually, the outfit you're wearing is one I made. I made many dresses for you when you were popular. "

s: ^"Mr.E in 314 ordered a cloak, can I go up to deliver it to him?"

c-0: ^CE says:"Oh, my. Yes, terrible. Terrible torments. Poor things."

SoundsLikeDontKnow: ^The tailor scorns"It almost sounds like you are not one of it."
^"But yes, you weren't a part of it. You were popular because you were healthy and happy."
CEFirstRoundChoicesChoices: ^CE:"Thank you for reminding me that I was so loved by then."
^"You are still the prettiest among us deads."
^"Yes, yes. We all had a bit more flesh or an extra tooth here or there, but you were smoooth like an egg."
^"My, my! You were smooth as an idiot's brain by then. What a superstar, Miss, what a star."
CETalksAboutE: ^CE:"Why, Mr.E jumped off the building a month ago and ended his death."
^"The police haven't even dealt with his case yet.There are just not enough deads for everything."
^"I have nothing to say about it."
TalkAboutEBurning: ^CE:"Yes. He burnt most of his work before he jumped down from the apartment roof. The works of over a hundred and thirty years."
^"I've heard of him, might have even read his books."
^"Sounds like everyone in this damn town, destroying unbearable stuff."
AfterTalkAboutEBurning: ^(Recalling the acquaintance causes the tailor some emotional damage)
^The tailor sinks into a silent reminiscence.
^CE scorns at the tailor:"You are not afraid of reminisce, eh? I see you are used to your illness."
CEScorn: ^"I am afraid. I am so scared."The tailor buries his hands in his hands.
^(Once started, the tailor just cannot stop reminiscing.)
^"The whole town is burried in newspapers. It's hard to breathe."
^"Everything looks like something or someone to me."
^"But yes,I don't want to rewind these. Anyways, umm...ugh...ok,why did E die?"
WhyEDied: ^CE:"Have you not throught about it? All of us share the same symptoms, how can you ask such an ignorant question?
^You enjoy being tortured by memories? Or do you plan to run away?"
^"I just couldn't let go of my tailor shop. But the business is not running now, I might get away."
^"Inferring you are planning to run away?"
CEPlanNoRun: ^CE says:"Don't know, my condition seems to progress slower...They hailed me as an idol  because of my smooth cheeks.I was an idol. A star. A healthy dead. A carefree butterfly.
^I'm trying to resume those good old days."
^"Maybe one day I'll have to leave too."
^"Dead and gone and shattered. It's about to become a ghost town."
^Let's run away. To the upper city, where people live and forget.
^What is the point of staying here anyways?
SomeOtherDay: ^CE says:"Don't know.Some other day, tailor. Some other day. The spikes hurt me from time to time, but they also kept me alert and conscious."
^"You know, I don't want to be an idiot that remembers nothing. So pain it be. But leave this sad place as you wish and don't worry about me."
^"Or maybe you can have a surgery to remove these tumors."

c-0: ^CE says:"Oh cut the jokes. There's no doctor left in this town.Some other day, tailor, some other day."
^"Maybe forgetting is the only surgery to take."

GetLost: ^CE says:"Now get lost. I won't turn you in to the police."
CESecondRound: ^CE:"Awh stop it, sweet heart. Stop the flatter. I wouldn't say that I was fortunate to have Alzheimer before my first death.But it is true that I didn't endure the burden of prolonged memory now. At least, not as much."

s: ^"I wouldn't say it's fortunate, but it reforms your afterlife down here."
^"You have the ability to forget! You are the rarest, the fairest of them all, Miss."
^"I'm sure that would reduce some torments of eternal existence."

c-0: ^"An early investment for an eternal afterlife."
c-1: ^"You see, you have the quality that everyone else here have not. How precious, ha, how brilliant!

CEThirdRound: ^CE:"You are such a stingy lemon, aren't you. Now here I am, with these spikes. See, we end up the same."
^" Just stop laughing at me, tailor. That is not the attitude to a lady."
Sofa: ^"I used to smoke with Claremont on this sofa a lot. He lived in this apartment. "
^"We used to have names longer than 2 letters. But now 2-letter combination can cover the population of 100. So gradually we've lost our names."
Mirror: ^The tailor sees an ugly, coarse face.
MirrorReflection: ^"Simply looking into the mirror reminds me the stories behind each hand."
^"Come on, every dead look somewhat like this."
^"That's not my face. I'm smooth like an idiot's brain."
LookAway: ^"What else can be more traumatic than looking at myself?"
^CE sighs from the front desk:"You know, sir, I should've been the one saying this. But I'm sure you also had a hard time. "
Alma: ^The tailor encounters a young person with three boobs on their face.
^"Are you new here? I have never seen your face before."
AlmaStartTalkingKnot: ^The person says:"Ah, sir, or ma'am, or whatever. It's hard to tell what you are. I'm Alma, died yesterday. "
^"Fresh and lively.The Union just dumped me here."
^"You know what? I was wondering why no one was here to welcome me, and then you showed up."
^"Unfortunately, I'm not here to welcome you.I'm going to where you came from."
AlmaSecondRound: ^Alma seems to be in his own world and doesn't reply to the tailor's greetings,"Those cloaked folks rough as hell, hauling me down here all tied up."
^"I recall they were quite polite when moving me down here."
DieReason: ^Alma says:" Well, I was in debt. I got run over by a lender's car. Maybe that's why the Union didn't care much about my body."
WasIdiot: ^Alma continues the rant:"I'm an idiot. A loser. An underdog. I couldn't remember anything, not any useful knowlegdge. But not anymore."
^"They said, when carrying my body, that after death, one has infinite life and memory in the underground city. Isn't that great? "
^"If I had known, I would have died earlier! I was going to die anyway when I was alive. But dead as I am now, I'm alive forever! And smart!"
^"Having endless memory isn't necessarily a good thing."
^"eternal existence here is pure torment. There's a reason why the deads are called the deads."
FoolLikeMe: ^Alma seems a little angry:"But of course it is a good thing! With infinite life and memory, I'll eventually know everything by endless training and making mistakes."
^"Yes, you can do that. All deads are like databases. Even CE the Alzheimer-ed star."
AlmaImagine: ^Alma is in a zest:"Then, I could be a poet, a drummer, a silversmith, a botanist, an opera singer, and...and a professor, no, a SAGE!"
^"Sir, this is a revolutionary liberation of the brain! I suggest everyone die, RIGHT NOW!"
^"Many of my old friends did pursue dramatically different careers in their prolonged death..."
WhatDoYouDo: ^Alma interrupts the tailor:"So, what do you do? How long have you been dead?"
^"Just a humble tailor. Been dead for 250 years."
YouIdiot: ^Alma says:"Oh, I see. So you are the IDIOT. 200 years was only enough for you to do just that."
^"No wonder you want to leave this place. It seems the infinite life and memory haven't elevated you. What a waste."
^" But I like making clothes for others."
ForReal: ^Alma exclaims in shock:"Wait, for real? No legends and tales, uncle? Swords and magic, love and hatred, redemption and sin? And...."
^"Maybe you are not an idiot. You are just an asshole socially."
Imsuffering: ^I'm just suffering like every other dead.
^(This young son of a bitch. He's giving the old tailor both mental and physical damage.)

^But Alma doesn't plan to get it over with,"I had heard the city of the dead was grand and orderly because of the endless knowledge. Yes, Yes! I recall that the Union used to send people down here to learn every year!"
AfterImSuffering: ^Alma becomes somewhat frantic: "Had I known death was so good, I would have killed myself earlier."
^(Maybe he is just an idiot. Thinking of this, A relaxes a little.)
^"It was, 50 years ago. People weren't so ill back then."
AlmaAskForget: ^The tailor goes on,"People here flee or die. Now, I'm leaving too, to forget."
^Alma:"Forget? What a waste. What a waste!"
^" Do you have any idea on my life? I was laughed at because I can't remember anything. But now, I'm different! I can feel it, I remember every word you say clearly!"
^"If I live another fifty years, wouldn't I become an elite grandee? Just like a vampire!"
^A is getting tired of Alma and turns to leave.
^"I want to be an idiot, like you."
WhereAreYouGoing: ^"To the upper city. Have you not been listening to me at all?"
^Alma says:"Though you only have knowledge of making clothes...But that's still some wisdom. Are you going to abandon your centuries of knowledge to become a forgetful fool again? "
HappyPerson: ^"A forgetful human is a living human,  not necessarily a fool. Being a fool is your own problem."

^Alma says:" You don't wanna continue challenging the peaks of knowledge with your limitless energy, professor? Besides, the upper city has been protesting against the Union lately.It's all a mess. The Union is severely understaffed, and the city is full of idiots everywhere. "
^"But we've learn that here is the heart of civilization from textbooks since kindergarten..."
^"Great! Glad that you are not one of the idiots this time!"
^"Great.Since no one's guarding, I'll make a run for it."
^"Well, good luck becoming a professor. Gotta run."
^"Suit yourself here, but I'm the idiot going up."
Lighthouse: ^The lighthouse is shut down because the Lighthouse keeper got arrested.
^There is an unknown corpse under the lighthouse.
^The tailor murmurs:"I remember WS and WE jumped from this tower. Is this place a popular spot for suicides, or has the undertakers long stopped operating?"
^(Well,well. There's just no way you can avoid A's friends' suicide spots. They are everywhere.)
^"You know what? I shall be with them. There's no meaning." A sounds serious.
^Don't kill yourself. It's ridiculous to die twice
^Run to the uppercity and everything will be fine.
^At least I'm sure you will have a gigantic Holloween party if you do that.
DontSuicide: ^"I... I'm getting the hell out of here!"
Seagull: ^(Chirps) Sailor! Sailor! Sail towards the raging sea!
Officer: ^A doesn't know the Officer's name. But the Officer has been the officer forever
OfficerChoices: ^"I heard you caught the Lighthouse Keeper? He's one of my clients. "
^"So the police department is dealing with E's suicide case?"
^"I have nothing else to day.Good day."

c-2: ^The Officer says:"You are talking about the writer who commited suicide a month ago. No, his case isn't dealt with."

OfficerHasBigHat: ^The Officer puts a huge hat on, covering all abnormalities on his head.
^The Officer says"Then I'll write you a check."
^The Officer says"I thought you came here to visit L, for the first time in the thirty years since L is in prison. But yes, thank you for the hat. It is brilliant. "
SeeL: ^A sinks into silence for a minute.
^"No, I don't want to see him. I can't face him." A says.
^The Officer says:"That's what I thought. You sent him behind those bars. And sir, your symptoms are severe."
ShopCantContinue: ^The officer shrugs:"Well, you made you choice. I have nothing to blame you as a police."
^(A recalls what he did to L 30 years ago in the name of justice. It was not good being stuck in the middle.)
^" To be honest, sir,I might run away, to the uppercity, and regain the ability to forget. "
^"Now that my shop is bankrupt, it doesn't matter what happens to me anyways."
^"And your symptoms aren't looking good either, Officer. Would you come with me?"
^"Hiding behind that hat doesn't make much difference, you know. It haunts your mind."
GoodQualityShop: ^"Nobody is buying clothes. You, E, and the Lighthouse Keeper are my last three customers."
^"My clothes are too good in quality; people don't need to buy new ones anymore."
^"Now there are only about a hundred people left in town, anyways."
^"The market is gone. Everyone is gone."
^"I heard that you caught the lighthouse keeper?"
LighthouseKeeper: ^"I need to deliver him his hat. "
^The Officer says:"I kept him, but shamefully, he escaped again. The Union arrested and brought him here, but now I'm the only police left... So naturally, he escaped again."
^"So it's down to a one-actor show, big man?"
^"Why are you still here then? The job is unachievable."
^"There is hardly any need for law enforcement in a town with only 100 people, eh?"
^"Good for him! You should resign, honestly."
PoliceResign: ^The Officer says:"Bitter as ever, tailor. Bitter as ever."
^"Why are you still doing the job, anyways. There aren't much to do."
^"You might want to run away with me."

c-1: ^"You must have felt guilty and painful enough in your police career...Just inferring from your symptoms, no offense. Forgetting might be the only cure for us."

OfficerRefuse: ^The Officer says:"I don't know, tailor. I don't know."
^He says:"Someone has to be the police, right? You know?"
^"The only thing I know is that you are very ill."
^"Even if you try to hide your illness under the hat."
SomeOneHasTo: ^The Officer says:"Those feelings and turmoils flash before my eyes and wake me up from nightmares...all the time... every time. "
^"You know what I mean, tailor. You have bloody hands too."
^"You sense the surge? All your guilt, disappointment, loss, and regret. That's ..."
^"Stop it. I don't want to recall more."
^"Stop it. I don't want to remember L. Or remember anything."
^"Stop it. Can we just forget it? Or pretend they don't exist?"
CantForget: ^The Officer says:"No one forgets anything here, sir. You are one of the dead, and that's the way it is."
^The Officer says:"Run away as you wish. But someone got to be the police. Can't left the office empty."
^The Officer goes on:"I heard that the Union is distracted by the strike in upper city. It is your best chance to run away."
^"You are not going to turn me in, are you?"
EscapeInstruction: ^The Officer says:"The Union keeps a boat by the port, to transport the deads down here when they die. "
^The Officer hands the tailor a key:"I happen to have a spare key for it. It violates my duty but...try your fortune, tailor. You might not be caught."
^"I heard there is a portal connecting the dead's city and the living's city up there."
^"Take care, Officer. And bid me good luck."
^"Now I see how the Lighthouse keeper got away. Maybe you shouldn't resign after all."
ECase: ^"Then adding a hat to E's belongings should be allowed?"
OfficerTalkAboutE: ^The Officer says:"E hasn't looked like himself for a long time. But anyways, he didn't care much about his appearance anymore,too."
^"He hasn't written any book for the past ten years. E has been living in severe delusions ever since Randy left him and run off to upper city."
^"You are living in delusion too, Officer."
^"He, you, and I, are all dead. How can we 'live' in delusions?"
^"Maybe. Perhaps. He get caught up by his past."
FriendOfE: ^The Officer says:"He didn't have a tailor shop to run, nor did he need to be a police officer. 27 years ago, E invited me to his house, crying that he discovered the epic he had just completed was so similar to something already written by someone else. After living for hundreds of years, we've become indifferent to any story. He went without food and drink for many days, thinking he was a mediocrity. Since then, he has been tormented by a lack of inspiration, burning every piece he wrote. Such a pitiable, pitiable writer."
^"A wroter. Haha. Ok, I didn't know he was your friend."
^"Sorry, I didn't know E was your friend. I shouldn't have asked so much, right?"
DidntKnow: ^The Officer says:"Yes...E is my friend. But that is okay.
^"I know you are an asshole since 200 years ago."
Prison: ^Are you sure the tailor would want to check it out?
VisitPrison: ^"No. I'm not going to visit L. I owe him too much."
^(Poor fella has some emotional damage now.)
^"Stop urging me to review my acquaintances."
NotVisitPrison: ^The tailor sighs:"L is in there. And he wouldn't want to see me after what I've done."
^"Farewell. Maybe someday we can be reunited up there, and I will finally have the courage to fix it al."
BedroomIntro: ^The door is ajar, "A" pushes it open and enters.
^"Ah...This is exactly like the apartment room I used to live in."
Pillow: ^The pillow is soaked in red and newspapers.
^Place the printed bill of the hat on the pillow.
^Look at the newspaper marks around the pillow.

c-1: ^"You haven't paid me yet. But you are gone already."

PlaceHat: ^"Better to leave his hat and other beloings together. There's not much left here anyways."
PillowWords: ^"The pillow is full of E's blood. It's heavy to contain a growing database of news in your head every day."
BurntDocuments: ^"Natural History and The Original Wandermaker" by Easton Emerson
^"Some books I read over the past 100 years. I didn't know they were written by him."
^"How peculiar it is to learn someone after his second death."

c-0: ^"He seems to have lived forever right by the next door."

PosterInBoat: ^Newspaper cutout: "Celine Easton is still alive?! Exclusive Interview!"
^The tailor puts down the whole collection pile:"Yeah, CE was a big star at that time.
^Those good old days. Her head was smooth like an egg by then."
SailingProcess: ^You can't believe you and this old tailor sailed for 5 whole days.
^A needs no food because he's dead, but it is boring as hell.
^You wrote some brief notes in A's mind:
^"Day 1: Our pockets light but spirits high, We're ready to outwit the Union or at least die humorously trying.
^Day 2: Amidst the vast wet nothingness, we were briefly joined by dolphin skeletons. I guess the janitors are all gone. Oh, no, maybe the janitors are among them? Oh, hell no.
^Day 3: Yes, a storm. Seagulls keep crashing on our front windows. RF should've seriously taught me how to speak bird language.
^Day 4: Post-storm, the sea pretended nothing happened, all calm and shiny, while we navigated by stars that didn't care if we died again. Ah, tailor, good old fella. I think we are almost there.
^Day 5: We found the tunnel's mouth. Looks like the Union also gone bankrupt.
^It still retains some of its once majestic structure, but the stacks of debris prove that it has fallen into disrepair over the years.
^At least there's no Union bastards hanging around."
UnionBuildingOnStart: ^Sails the tailor, into a bizzare tunnel.
^As the shore solidifies gradually, the tailor starts on his feet.
intro: ^(Click to interact with objects. Press arrow keys to move around.)
^(When you walk around, keep cursor at the center of the screen if you don't want to miss any interactable objects)
^Your body feels like a gum sticked to the concret floor.
^The pain from your head starts to penetrate your mind.
^No. You still have something to do.
ToChapter2: ^"It is very suspicious that not a single Union member is around."
^"Or an old one that is long gone."
^"I can smell happiness. It smells like almond coissant."
